intro: Siphocampylus linearifolius, commonly known as the slenderleaf siphocampylus, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant features slender, linear leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette, with small, white to pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
